meta_description: Discover calories in a bottle of red wine (750 ml standard), including carbs, alcohol content, per-100 ml breakdown, and serving tweaks for better tracking.
h1: Calories in a Bottle of Red Wine
assumptions: Standard 750 ml bottle; average dry red wine (e.g., Cabernet Sauvignon or Merlot), 13% ABV, no added sugars.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by wine type, brand, alcohol content, sweetness, and bottle size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard 750 ml bottle of red wine contains about 638 kcal, mostly from alcohol and carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a bottle of red wine?
faqs.a: Approximately 638 kcal for a standard 750 ml bottle of dry red wine.
Yes, about 19.5 g total carbs in a bottle, mainly from natural sugars and alcohol.

faqs.q: Calories per glass of red wine?
faqs.a: A standard 150 ml glass has ~128 kcal; adjust for pour size.

faqs.q: Is red wine low in fat or sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, 0 g fat and only 30 mg sodium per bottle, making it heart-friendly in moderation.

faqs.q: How does wine type affect calories?
faqs.a: Dry reds are lower (~85 kcal/100 ml); sweeter varieties or higher ABV increase calories by 10-20%.
